benchmark_details.name: 3LM
benchmark_details.overview: 3LM is a suite of three benchmarks designed specifically for Arabic, focusing on STEM domains including mathematics, physics, chemistry, biology, and code generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance Arabic LLM research in STEM and programming domains.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark primarily targets middle and high school-level content.

data.source: 3LM benchmark consists of native and synthetic questions from Arabic educational materials and machine-translated code benchmarks.
data.annotation: Manual and automatic generation processes, with human verification.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using model predictions against the correct answers from the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy on benchmark tasks indicates model proficiency in STEM and code generation for the Arabic language.
methodology.validation: Benched against over 40 state-of-the-art Arabic and multilingual LLMs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes diverse Arabic educational materials.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential biases in synthetic question generation reflecting model limitations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All datasets are publicly available under open-source licenses.
